answerText: Multipole Expansion[10] Each term in multipole expansion is one of these mathematical entities.  They are defined by their behavior under rotation--a rank zero example is a scalar, rank one a vector, and rank two can be expressed as a matrix.
heading: ACF Regionals |2012 | Maryland A + Chicago B | 16 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer some questions about a certain approximation scheme, for 10 points each: [10] This method to approximate a function that depends on angles expands the function in powers of inverse distance from a center.  Common uses of this technique include estimating the electric field of a charge distribution.
